sources.data_found: NSF Grant (Aug 2022): Mentions acquisition of a new cluster featuring NVIDIA A100 GPUs (deployment quantity not specified in public specs yet).
2022 Degrees Awarded in Computer & Information Sciences: 87 Bachelor's, 9 Master's, 3 Research Doctorates.

student_data.notes: Exact enrollment headcounts by major are not publicly available on the Ole Miss Institutional Research site without restricted access. Counts are estimated from DataUSA/IPEDS 2022 degrees awarded. Undergrad estimate: 87 degrees × 4.5 years = ~392. MS estimate: 9 degrees × 3 years (conservative for steady state) = 27. PhD estimate: 3 degrees × 6 years = 18.

gpu_resources.notes: Counts derived from the Mississippi Center for Supercomputing Research (MCSR) hardware page. Maple Cluster: 4 nodes × 2 V100 = 8 V100s. A 2022 NSF grant announcement mentions the acquisition of NVIDIA A100 GPUs, but the specific node count and specification (40GB vs 80GB) have not yet been updated on the public hardware registry, so they are excluded from the numeric totals to maintain auditability. [WARNING: Original source was inaccessible, using fallback.]

analysis_notes: The primary HPC resource is MCSR. Verified hardware lists V100s. Newer A100 resources are mentioned in press releases but not yet quantified in technical documentation.
